ETYMOLOGY: From Anglo-Norman and Old French successour, from Latin successor, from succēdere ('follow after'), from sub- ('after') + cēdere ('go').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person or thing that takes a place or position previously held by someone or something else.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 接替或继承某人或某物位置或职位的人或事物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The vice president was the natural successor to the presidency.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 副总统是总统职位的当然继承人。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A product, idea, or development that replaces an earlier one.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 取代早期产品、想法或发展的事物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new model is a worthy successor to its popular predecessor.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新型号是其广受欢迎的前代的有力继承者。
